body: I got the following runtime error when using the latest **Run Energy Simulation** component for a simple model: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/I2UHAZfIP7aBbD8zdEitV3tNZW7v9OxjZJDsNtMBRv4wiV-tlTsysZLGk3ZYt6nwXBG6qAOp5ULEabMcUyk6xn37SZOlni7b/Image6.png) ... and it seems before the simulation it is reminding me mandatory input is missing although all required inputs have been specified: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/I2UHAZfIP7a6bOndTdyC6hqxfRyELhrr-wVO9K9WvnkWQ8S70m5WuHm6wrJcDcMG6G7DF*uVQkn7nWdTwteq0n11nVQqWN9W/Image7.png) May I ask what's the course of this issue? Thank you! - Ji
topic: [solved] Run Energy Simulatino component runtime error

replies.body: I run the IDF generated through EP-Launch, and it seems that all the default material definitions used for the default constructions are all missing ... May I ask how come the materials are not written into the IDF file using the **Run Energy Simulation** component? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/I2UHAZfIP7YCWPA0oPzUJ4Z*g6eeV2NNuLrThXf4-FcKt59FYecqyHrpMnIVjZs0MZJX*9Cfyqo77o2tFmu0kmf5Afc17cac/Image3.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/I2UHAZfIP7a1MKbihcDl4wgzydVNhCNtEZsEz1CgGck2s-wHZ1vm6IrUNszSiNeufn6gn3vOzCF7tkOaWXuxk3C4yP07aeq*/Image2.png) There is no such problem when using the **Export to OpenStudio** component to run the simulation: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/I2UHAZfIP7Yfh*i2P4KEleDe83FT1PMIZWgPba7Xb3vsRdsVJ6osnKwNYcM49tD4554BoZEoZFA4w05p8-WhIMGCyJsaog0s/Image4.png)
the idf file and GH file are attached

Hi Ji,

Your file (test.gh) runs fine on my machine ... :-) or :-(?

Good news?

I suggest closing GH and Rhino and trying again.

-A.

Hi Ji,



This is my fault.  I made a change last night to put in more functionality with imported constructions from LBNL WINDOW and I was only checking the impact on the OpenStudio component (not the E+ component).  This is fixed now:

[https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/commit/752565a33ad9257...](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/commit/752565a33ad925754c2d9d4c9c7f37266a19300a)



-Chris

Dear Chris and Abraham, thank you very much for the very prompt update! It works fine now.

- Ji
